Package ohos.ivihardware.vehiclecontrol

Class VehicleBodyManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.vehiclecontrol.VehicleBodyManager

  • public class VehicleBodyManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A public class that obtains vehicle signal information in the body.

    This class provides basic body signal identifiers and signal access methods. You can use the defined body signal identifiers to obtain specified signal values.

    The body provides signals for the following components: Lights, Mirrors, Windshields, Lights, RearShade and RefuelPosition.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.VehicleControl

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <T> T getVehicleSignal​(java.lang.Class<T> propClass, java.lang.String bodyPropertyId, int bodyZone)
      Obtains the signal value of a vehicle.
      static <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,T> getVehicleSignalMultiAreas​(java.lang.Class<T> propClass, java.lang.String bodyPropertyId, int bodyZone)
      Obtains the values of a specified signal from multiple vehicle zones.
      static <T> void setVehicleActuator​(java.lang.String bodyProperty, int bodyZone, VehicleActuatorCallback callback, T value)
      Sets the actuator value of a vehicle.
      static VsSubscription subscribeVehicleSignal​(java.lang.String bodyPropertyId, int bodyZone, VehicleSignalCallback vehicleBodyCallback, SubscriberFilter filters)
      Subscribes to the signal value of a vehicle.
      static void unsubscribeVBodySignal​(VsSubscription subscription)
      Unsubscribes from the body signal of a vehicle with the VsSubscription handle.
      static void unsubscribeVBodySignalAll​()
      Unsubscribes from all the body signals of a vehicle by the application.

      • ID_BODY_TRAVELLEDDISTANCE

        public static final java.lang.String ID_BODY_TRAVELLEDDISTANCE
        Description: Indicates the odometer reading.

      • VehicleBodyManager

        public VehicleBodyManager​()

    • Method Detail

      • getVehicleSignal

        public static <T> T getVehicleSignal​(java.lang.Class<T> propClass,
                                     java.lang.String bodyPropertyId,
                                     int bodyZone)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                     java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the signal value of a vehicle.

        You can obtain the signal value of only the specified signal in a vehicle zone. You must use a variable whose data type is the same as that of the specified signal to save the result.

        Sample code for obtaining the signal value of a vehicle: 

         String signalValue = VehicleBodyManager.getVehicleSignal(String.class,
             VehicleBodyManager.ID_BODY_WINDSHIELD_WIPING_STATUS, VehicleZone.ZONE_FRONT);
        Parameters:
        propClass - Indicates the data type wrapper for the specified signal, for example, Long.class.
        bodyPropertyId - Identifies a vehicle signal, which can be of the attribute, signal, or actuator type.
        bodyZone - Indicates the vehicle zone (default value: entire vehicle), which is defined in VehicleZone. All options of the bodyZone signal have been listed in the description of the bodyPropertyId for each vehicle.
        Returns:
        Returns the signal value. Returns the signal value of the boolean, byte, short, int, long, float, double, or string type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • getVehicleSignalMultiAreas

        public static <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,T> getVehicleSignalMultiAreas​(java.lang.Class<T> propClass,
                                                                                java.lang.String bodyPropertyId,
                                                                                int bodyZone)
                                                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                                                                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the values of a specified signal from multiple vehicle zones.

        The data type can be boolean, byte, short, integer, long, float, double, or string. You must use a map whose value type is the same as that of the specified signal to save the result.

        Sample code for obtaining signal values from multiple vehicle zones: 

         int zone = VehicleZone.ZONE_NONE;
 Map<Integer, Boolean> valueMap = VehicleBodyManager.getVehicleSignalMultiAreas(Boolean.class,
 VehicleBodyManager.ID_BODY_MIRRORS_PAN, zone);
        Parameters:
        propClass - Indicates the data type wrapper for the specified signal, for example, Long.class.
        bodyPropertyId - Identifies the vehicle signal, for example, ID_BODY_BODYTYPE. The node type can be attribute, signal, or actuator.
        bodyZone - Indicates the vehicle zone, which is defined in VehicleZone. All zone options have been listed in the description of bodyPropertyId for a vehicle signal. For example, the value ZONE_NONE indicates all the vehicle zones for the specified signal, and the value ZONE_ROW1 indicates that the left and right areas of the first row.
        Returns:
        Returns a map of key-value pairs to store the signal values from multiple vehicle zones. In the map, keys are the vehicle zones defined in VehicleZone, and values are the signal values from the specified zones. The data type can be boolean, byte, short, integer, long, float, double, or string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • setVehicleActuator

        public static <T> void setVehicleActuator​(java.lang.String bodyProperty,
                                          int bodyZone,
                                          VehicleActuatorCallback callback,
                                          T value)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                          java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the actuator value of a vehicle.

        The actuator can be a unique signal in the entire vehicle or a signal of the same type in a zone of the vehicle. If the setting is successful, no value is returned.

        Sample code for setting the actuator value of a vehicle: 

         String propId = VehicleBodyManager.ID_BODY_HOOD_ISOPEN;
 int zoneId = VehicleZone.ZONE_NONE;
 Boolean value = false;
 VehicleActuatorCallback callback = new VehicleActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int zoneId, int outResult) {
     }
 };
 VehicleBodyManager.setVehicleActuator(propId, zoneId, callback, value);
        Parameters:
        bodyProperty - Identifies a vehicle signal, which can be of the actuator type.
        bodyZone - Indicates the vehicle zone (default value: entire vehicle), which is defined in VehicleZone. All options of the bodyZone signal have been listed in the description of the bodyProperty for each vehicle. Multiple values of bodyZone can be combined, for example, you can set bodyZone to ZONE_ROW1 | ZONE_POS1 and ZONE_ROW1 | ZONE_POS2 to get their intersection ZONE_ROW1.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        value - Indicates the assigned signal value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • subscribeVehicleSignal

        public static VsSubscription subscribeVehicleSignal​(java.lang.String bodyPropertyId,
                                                    int bodyZone,
                                                    VehicleSignalCallback vehicleBodyCallback,
                                                    SubscriberFilter filters)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the signal value of a vehicle.

        This is an asynchronous method. The signal value must be of only the specified signal in a vehicle zone.

        Sample code for subscribing to the signal value of a vehicle: 

         private class VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback implements VehicleSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     // default implementation empty
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int zoneId, int errorCode) {
     // default implementation empty
     }
 }
 SubscriberFilter testFilter = new SubscriberFilter();
 VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback testCallback = new VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback();
 String propId = VehicleBodyManager.ID_BODY_WINDSHIELD_HEATING_STATUS;
 int zoneId = VehicleZone.ZONE_FRONT;
 VsSubscription result = VehicleBodyManager.subscribeVehicleSignal(propId, zoneId, testCallback, testFilter);
        Parameters:
        bodyPropertyId - Identifies a vehicle body signal, which can be of the actuator and sensor type.
        bodyZone - Indicates the vehicle zone (default value: entire vehicle), which is defined in VehicleZone. All options of the bodyZone signal have been listed in the description of the bodyPropertyId for each vehicle.
        vehicleBodyCallback - Indicates the callback function of the subscription.
        filters - Indicates the subscription policy (SubscriberFilter), which can be interval, range, or minchange. This parameter can be default (interval 200ms, below Long.MIN_VAL, above Long.MAX_VAL, minchange 1).
        Returns:
        Returns VsSubscription if subscription is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        4

      • unsubscribeVBodySignal

        public static void unsubscribeVBodySignal​(VsSubscription subscription)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                          java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from the body signal of a vehicle with the VsSubscription handle.

        No exception is thrown if the unsubscription is successful.

        Sample code for unsubscribing to the signal value of a vehicle: 

         private class VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback implements VehicleSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     // default implementation empty
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int zoneId, int errorCode) {
     // default implementation empty
     }
 }
 SubscriberFilter testFilter = new SubscriberFilter();
 VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback testCallback = new VehicleBodyManagerTestSubCallback();
 String propId = VehicleBodyManager.ID_BODY_WINDSHIELD_HEATING_STATUS;
 int zoneId = VehicleZone.ZONE_FRONT;
 VsSubscription result = new VsSubscription();
 result = VehicleBodyManager.subscribeVehicleSignal(propId, zoneId, testCallback, testFilter);
 VehicleBodyManager.unsubscribeVBodySignal(result);
        Parameters:
        subscription - Identifies a subscription.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • unsubscribeVBodySignalAll

        public static void unsubscribeVBodySignalAll​()
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from all the body signals of a vehicle by the application.

        No value is returned if the unsubscription is successful.

        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        Since:
        1
